thread.title: JD Sports FY profit to beat expectations
thread.title_full: JD Sports FY profit to beat expectations

title: JD Sports FY profit to beat expectations
text:
JD's full-year profit is set to beat market forecasts by 10% 
UK retailer JD Sports Fashion has said its full-year profit will beat forecasts, thanks to better than expected first-half sales, but warned currency headwinds will impact margins. 
The group expects profit before tax to be 10% ahead of market expectations of around GBP100m (US$155.7m). JD said first-half like-for-like sales remained in excess of management forecasts, but reiterated that margins have been impacted by a weak euro. 
Commenting on the update, Investec analyst Kate Calvert said: &quotThe ongoing strength of JDâ€™s brand relationships, continued momentum in footwear and range development should help support future growth in the UK. A focussed, profitable business in Europe is capable of offering additional upside." 
JD Sports Fashion's share price was up 8.2% to GBP808 pence at 9:32 BST today (31 July).
